jobs.title: Senior Manager Business Analysis
jobs.description:
Senior Manager-Business Analysis

Location: Long Island City, NY,11101/ Bethpage, NY/ Piscataway, NJ (3 days per week onsite...

Contract to Hire

Job Description: We are seeking a Sr. Mgr., Business Analysis to support our telecommunications client on-site in Long Island City, New York. The Sr. Mgr., Business Analysis engages with the business owners and key stakeholders in the operational, financial, and strategic analysis of new and existing business opportunities and enhancements. Additionally, he/she works in close partnership with the Product Owners to represent the needs of the various functional areas of a company. He/She is accountable for customer centric analyses to support strategies and business needs, overall quality of business and functional requirements, and delivery of the solution.

Responsibilities
• Supports the Business and Product Owners to define the business requirements at high-level using Jira Epics/Features from the customer lens with clear acceptance criteria and definition of “done”.
• Partner closely with technology and cross-functional business teams to shape the product strategy, define and develop the vision, create a differentiated value proposition, and identify high-value growth scenarios that provide a catalyst for growth.
• Partner closely with technology and cross-functional business teams to define the product development Capacity Management model. This includes tracking on bandwidth and capacity utilization through quarterly planning, prioritization, and impact/tradeoff analysis.
• Support Business and Product Owners to build their Investment Justification (Business Case) for various product development projects and to track the post-launch benefit realized to measure the ROI attainment for every product development project.
• Align with Business and Product Owners on the key performance indicators (KPI) for various business verticals and portfolios, and report on them through various information radiators (scorecards, dashboards, newsletters, … etc.)
• Partner closely with technology and cross-functional business teams to estimate the Level Of Effort (LOE) for each product development project which supports the investment justification and capacity planning processes.
• Provides guidance and coaching on tools to use to support the product development process and portfolio management (Clarity PPM, Jira, Power BI)

Skills
• 10+ years’ experience in the areas of Business Analysis, Portfolio Management, or Product Management preferably in telecommunications and technology domains
• Expert in working in an Agile environment (Scrum, Kanban, SAFe, Tribes/Squads)
• Experience with Customer Experience design methodologies such as Journey Mapping and A/B Testing along with CX metrics such as NPS and CSAT
• Expert knowledge of business analysis tasks like analysis and documentation of business requirements and coordination of development efforts, maintaining knowledge of current tools, technology, and methodologies, executing data collection and interpretation, and providing analytical customer insights and advice
• Experience in planning and prioritization of demand to support the organization.
• Excellent communication skills
• Analytical mindset and ability to synthesize complex information, connect ideas with data and present in digestible, easy to understand format

jobs.title: Business Analyst
jobs.description:
As the business analyst, you will be the primary liaison between Gen II’s Treasury and Information Technology teams focusing on the development, implementation, and continuous improvement of GEN II’s treasury management system (TMS). Key areas to include automating wire-based payments, integrating data from multiple banks, implementing interfaces between the TMS and Gen II’s accounting systems... and rolling out new functionality to the end-user community.

The role of the business analyst also includes end-user technical support and training as well as the maintenance, improvement, and integration of fund accounting platforms with the TMS. You will act as a partner to business operations teams to collect and document their needs on various initiatives, and you will participate in the technical development lifecycle of new solutions.

Primary Responsibilities Will Include:

Business analysis:
• Leads the identification and documentation of business requirements for the integration between existing Gen II systems and the TMS.
• Analyzes and challenges business requirements to implement new features in the existing TMS (Bank reconciliation, payments, bank statements…)
• Works on the interface between the TMS and the banks to be integrated (Mapping, Data analysis, Testing…)
• Identifies and helps to prioritize possible enhancements across existing systems.
• Assesses the impact of proposed technical and operational changes on our core business (Private equity, Accounting, SWIFT Payments…)

Business support:
• Become the in-house subject-matter-expert (SME) on system functionality and process workflows.
• Provide guidance and support to business teams with new-client onboarding activities.
• Assist client service teams with day-to-day requests and inquiries.

Project management:
• Maintain detailed project plans and timelines covering all IT related project activities in partnership with Treasury management to ensure consistent messaging.
• Take a leadership role in new projects supporting Treasury Management System, fund accounting platform, data migrations…
• Manage a portfolio of active projects/tasks and be able to manage/communicate the daily progress.
• Collaborate with the different project actors across the organization and at different levels.

Development:
• Work closely with the IT development team to develop and maintain data interfaces between existing fund accounting platforms and the TMS.
• Design any necessary new reports and features in accounting/reporting platforms.

Job Requirements, Skills, Education and Experience:
• Masters/ Bachelor’s degree in engineering, computer science, IT or project management.
• 2+ years of experience.
• Understanding SWIFT messages (MT101, MT103, MT940.)
• Ability to manipulate large sets of data.
• Strong understanding of cash management, investment management processes and related accounting rules.
• Knowledge of a treasury management system.
• Ability to work independently and effectively prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.
• Ability to prioritize, think independently, and handle multiple tasks at a time.
• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think creatively and outside the box.
• Superior written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner.
• Strong attention to detail and project management skills, with the ability to lead cross-functional teams and drive projects to completion.
• Fluent in English.

Nice to have:
• Knowledge of Hazeltree Treasury Management platform is strongly preferred.
• Knowledge of Allvue, Sage Intacct, eFront or any other Fund Accounting platform.
• Knowledge of Private Equity/Real Estate or corporate finance.
• Knowledge of at least one coding language (Javascript, VBA…).
• Experience/Knowledge of programming in SQL.

The salary range for this position is $120,000-$150,000, in addition to a comprehensive benefits package. Please note that the actual salary offered within that range will depend on the candidate’s experience level.

About the Company

Gen II Fund Services, LLC is one of the largest global independent private equity fund administrators, administering over $1 trillion of private capital on behalf of its clients with offices in New York, San Francisco, Boston, Stamford, Dallas, Denver, Vancouver, and Luxembourg. Gen II offers private fund sponsors a best-in-class combination of people, process, and technology, enabling fund sponsors to most effectively manage their operational infrastructure, financial reporting, and investor communications. The Gen II team is the most experienced and longest tenured team in the private equity fund administration industry, with broad expertise across buyout, funds of funds, real estate, energy, infrastructure, credit, co-investment, hybrid funds, feeder funds, venture capital, retail, and managed accounts.

Key Facts:
• Administering over $1T in assets
• Servicing nearly every significant investor in the asset class
• Institutional grade infrastructure and SSAE 18 (SOC-1, Type 2) certification, ensuring confidence in our processes and operating model
• The most experienced and best performing team in the industry

jobs.title: Business Analyst
jobs.description:
Position Summary
The Business Analyst is responsible for providing functional support to Enrollment Management and units across the University for the University student information system (SIS) and other ancillary systems/applications. This position oversees the management of data integrity, provides training, and creates documentation. The Business Analyst maintains advanced knowledge of... University system functionality, analyzes business processes/procedures, and identifies dependencies and implications of change to various functional areas and integration points with other systems. The Business Analysts is expected to design, configure, develop, test, implement and maintain approved applications, including reports, interfaces, and data conversions. They must communicate and coordinate effectively and professionally with business owners to ensure accurate understanding and acceptance of system configurations.
Qualifications

Required Education:Bachelor’s Degree
Preferred Education:Experience with batch process schedulers (BMC Control M, PeopleSoft, or similar). Relevant courses (systems analysis, database systems, Java, web programming)
Required Experience:At least 2 years related experience or equivalent combination, with student applications in an academic environment. Must include experience with systems applications and analysis, integrated systems and providing user support services. Strong functional and technical experience in the PeopleSoft Student Records Campus Solutions module.
Preferred Experience:Experience with security administration for related systems and applications (e.g., PeopleSoft) and supporting mainframe systems.
Required Skills, Knowledge and Abilities:Ability to diagnose & troubleshoot system errors with exceptional attention to detail and accuracy. Strong team player as well as demonstrate the ability to complete projects independently. Proficient with MS office applications. Ability to effectively communicate technical information to non-technical audience. Able to complete tasks with aggressive timelines. Strong desire to serve students, faculty, and administrators in an university support setting. Excellent organizational, interpersonal, communication and client support skills. PeopleSoft Campus Solutions Query, SQL experience, BRIO, Tableau or similar reporting tool. Ability to interact with a diverse population and all levels of personnel, and to demonstrate tact and diplomacy when in dealing with difficult issues and/or diverse organizations. Ability to develop positive and cooperative relationships with students, faculty, staff, parents, professional colleagues, and the public.
Preferred Skills, Knowledge and Abilities:Demonstrate understanding of programming logic (examples: SQL, XML, HTML, and/or JavaScript). Understands the working of a relational database (examples: PeopleSoft 9.x, ImageNow). Experience with Windows OS, Linux/Unix.
Additional Information
In compliance with NYC's Pay Transparency Act, the annual base salary range for this position is USD $73,800.00 to USD $90,200.00. New York University considers factors such as (but not limited to) scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate's work experience, education/training, key skills, internal peer equity, as well as, market and organizational considerations when extending an offer. This pay range represents base pay only and excludes any additional items such as incentives, bonuses, clinical compensation, or other items. jobs.title: Sr Technical Business Analyst - Onsite
jobs.description:
Job description :

We are trying to source Sr. Technical Business Analyst for our direct client for a long-term project onsite project at Brooklyn, NY. We need Senior Business Analyst who will assist in requirements management and corresponding program initiatives...

It will be a Long-Term Onsite Project at Brooklyn, NY.
• *****We need only Local candidates only (NY or NJ Area)*****

Project Goals for this contract include:
• Implement the standard SDLC methodology of gathering requirements to determine business requirements.
• Review business needs to provide developers requirements for modifications and enhancements
• Manage the application that allows providers to create an invoice, budget, and enrollment
• Updating new functions and processes based on business needs Client requires IT professional services to support day-to-day needs for critical business functions and objectives of the Client\u2019s application.

The Senior Technical Business Analyst will be responsible for, but not limited to:
• Analyzing administrative and operational processes and procedures to facilitate the implementation of new systems or modifications to existing systems
• Identifying business needs, developing functional requirements documents, and evaluating potential business solutions
• Conducting data analytics, mapping, and database analysis to define, document, prioritize, and validate business and system functional requirements
• Creating business and system functional requirement documents, as well as complex COGNOS reports, studies and other business analysis artifacts.

OUTLINE OF RESPONSIBILITIES
• Evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.
• Communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver functional requirements, e.g., Business Requirements Documents. Use Cases, GUI, screen layouts and interface designs.
• Utilize enterprise-wide requirements definitions and management systems and methodologies, as required.
• Work independently with users to define concepts and report out on findings to an assigned Project Manager.
• Drive and challenge business units on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plans
• Interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.
• Serve as the conduit between the customer community (internal and external customers) and the software development team through which requirements flow.
• Develop requirements specifications according to standard templates, using natural language.
• Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs.
• Maintain a liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams.
• Lead requirements analysis and verification, ensuring that requirement statements are complete and verifiable, and that they conform to standards.

MANDATORY MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

The successful candidate must have minimally achieved the following level of experience:
• 8+ years of experience writing and maintaining functional testing for enterprise level systems
• Minimum 8+ years of Experience working with planning, process analysis, and problem solving.
• Minimum 8+ years of Experience working with Microsoft Office products such as MS Project, MS Access, Visio, PowerPoint, Excel and Word.
• Minimum 8+ years of Experience in software engineering and information technology.
• Minimum 5+ years of Experience in Microsoft SQL Server databases, SQL Reporting tools
• Minimum 5+ years of Experience working with Microsoft TFS, TFS Release Manger and Cognos
• Minimum 5+ years of Experience in TFS Test Manager, QA testing, Test Plan and Test Cases.
• Minimum 8+ years of Experience in Software Development Life cycle \u2013 Agile methodology.

PREFERABLE QUALIFICATIONS
• Minimum 6 years of Financial Data Analytics
• Bachelor\u2019s Degree in computer science from an accredited college, at minimum
• Prior education industry/project experience
• Excellent oral and written communication skills; ability to communicate in a credible and confident manner at all levels in the organization especially on technical issues to a non-technical audience.
• Detailed and process oriented

Modeling, developing, designing, implementing, enhancing, maintaining, documenting requirements, creating and maintaining technical/functional design documents for multiple software systems and legacy applications.

Business Analyst Mandatory Skills
• An experienced forward-thinking leader who can understand business processes and how technology solutions can increase efficiency and productivity.
• Detail-oriented who knows how to extract and elicit all the right relevant information pertaining to current business processes.
• Proven ability to develop and maintain functional and technical design documents that are handed to software developers.

Business Analyst Preferred Experience And Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
• Experience in creating, documenting, evaluating, analyzing, and communicating systems requirements on a continuous basis
• Experience with Accela, CRM Microsoft Dynamics, SQL
• Experience maintaining systems process documents, including the delivery of ongoing status sessions

Assumptions Regarding Consultant Tasks and Deliverables

Description

The Business Analyst shall provide Information Technology BA consultant services to DOB and will be responsible for supporting business decisions by managing, analyzing, and creating design documents. The following descriptions and deliverables shall apply:

Role: The Business Analyst is tasked with supporting business decisions by managing, analyzing, and creating design documents, workflow charts/diagrams, test scripts/scenarios, and more. The role covers tasks associated with both existing applications and new applications (such as BIS, inspection databases), and programming changes to existing applications including Accela, CRM Microsoft Dynamics, and various other DOB applications and systems.

The selected candidate will be expected to proficiently complete tasks such as modeling, developing, designing, implementing, enhancing, maintaining, and identifying requirements for multiple software systems and legacy applications.

Objective: The Business Analyst will be responsible for understanding business processes and exploring how technology solutions can enhance efficiency and productivity. The role involves extracting and eliciting relevant information pertaining to current business processes, documenting, evaluating, analyzing, and continuously communicating system requirements.

The analyst is expected to develop and maintain functional and technical design documents, write, communicate, and execute different levels of test scenarios and test scripts. Additionally, they will evaluate and thoroughly explain system development to DOB software developers, support the training development team by creating and reviewing training materials, participate in system demos, and create and implement precise management plans.

Deliverables: The Business Analyst is responsible for the following:

• Develop and maintain functional and technical design documents
• Create, document, evaluate, analyze, and communicate systems requirements on a continuous basis
• Participate in system demos to different stakeholders and ensure business and technology aligns
• Create and implement precise management plans, presentations, and/or reports for every project

With a multi-disciplinary, collaborative model, we help clients understand their... competitive digital maturity, develop effective strategies, and transform using our IP-led platforms and technology services. Completely focused on the Digital Evolution philosophy and phenomenon, we view delivering our value proposition consistently as a non-negotiable commitment. Our enablers include Intelligent Team Formations, a Client-Centric Approach, Predictability in Execution, and establishing a Unique Relationship Experience. A culture of innovation, encouraging our people to create, and belief in the importance of training and development set us apart.

Role: Business Analyst
Employment Type: Contract – 6-9 Months subject to extension
Location: 3 days a week working from Manhattan , NY and 2 days remote as of now.

Trianz is looking for a Business Analyst to support our applications in the FinTech ecosystem (Wealth Management / Asset Management).

We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst to support our applications in the FinTech ecosystem (Wealth Management / Asset Management). This role will require skills in business analysis, systems analysis, documentation of business/functional requirements, customer relationships, solution recommendation, and decision making. Understanding mutual funds, life insurance and/or annuity products would be a plus.

• This role requires skills in business analysis, systems analysis, documentation of business/functional requirements, customer relationships, solution recommendation, and decision making.
• Understanding mutual funds, life insurance and/or annuity products would be a plus.

Job Responsibilities

jobs.title: Web Portal Business Analyst
jobs.description:
Company Description

Global Investment Bank...

Job Description

This role is responsible for the Business Analysis for portal-related projects and the firm’s Intranet portals. This role may also cover various portal services such as search, mobile, and content management projects.

This role will provide business analysis skills throughout the project life-cycle, i.e. analysis, design, development, testing, implementation and hand-over. The work includes requirements gathering, functional specification definition, data analysis, test use case planning and preparation, project planning, tracking and delivery. The role requires close interaction with business users; senior stakeholders, other development teams, support teams, infrastructure teams and project teams to ensure projects & services are delivered on schedule with high quality. The role will suit an experienced business analyst with a solid enterprise technical background and interest and/or experience in project management.

Main Duties

This role will have the following major duties and responsibilities:
• Work as a team player in a global development group participating in business requirements/functional specification definition, data analysis and design liaising with both Business and IT teams.
• Support and coordinate system implementations through the project lifecycle (initiation, planning, analysis/design, development, implementation, testing, rollout, and hand-over) working with other teams on a local and global basis.
• Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow analysis.
• Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.
• Drive and challenge business units on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plans.
• Strong analytic and product-management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.
• Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs.
• Strong analytical skills, self-motivated and capable of working in a dynamic global environment that demands multi-tasking.
• Ability to generate ideas and efficiently mock up proposals and orchestrate demos

Basic Qualifications:
• B.S. degree in computer science or related field with emphasis on technology
• 5+ years of technical or development experience
• 3+ years experience writing Business Requirement Documents and Functional Specification Documents

Preferred Qualifications:

jobs.title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
jobs.description:
We’re looking for a Business Intelligence Data Analyst with strong communication skills to join our team at Loris.ai. This person will be critical to providing the Product and Business Development teams with data-based insights to inform strategic decisions.

Our ideal candidate is highly inquisitive with a passion for uncovering business insights in large amounts of data. This is a... cross-functional Product role that will operate cross-functionally with Data Science, Engineering, CX, Sales, and external stakeholders.

Challenges you’ll tackle:
• Track, analyze, and visualize key metrics that highlight the health of our product and opportunities for improvement
• Conduct insightful analysis using a multitude of data (e.g. user, revenue, product, market, industry) to drive business growth
• Go beyond creating reporting dashboards -- identify, analyze, and interpret trends and patterns in complex data sets, then summarize key findings and propose action plans.
• Support the CX team through customer Pilots and quarterly business reviews by analyzing client data and producing actionable, meaningful insights
• Own database documentation and be a key influencer in how our data is managed
• Explore large amounts of client data to uncover business insights
• Regularly conduct statistical analysis on new and existing customer datasets to
• Provide quality assurance of imported data

Qualities you embody:
• Comfortable presenting to business stakeholders and able to explain complex, technical concepts to non-technical audiences
• Self-starter who takes initiative
• Can think strategically and operate tactically
• Keen business sense with the uncanny ability to tell a story through data that is both statistically sound and resonates with executive stakeholders
• Ability to thrive in a cross-functional environment driving alignment across stakeholders
• Forward-thinking, well organized, and have an obsession for detail

Skills you have:
• BS or above in Math, Statistics, Economics, or a related field
• 1-3 years of work experience in a quantitative or analytical role within a consulting or business organization
• Expert in SQL, experience with Python also a plus
• Proficiency in product analytics tools (Amplitude, Looker, Periscope, etc.)
• Ability to work independently with minimal supervision
• Excellent multitasking skills to manage multiple projects simultaneously and work with various cross functional stakeholders
• Hands on experience with other BI tooling preferable
• Successful outcomes producing slide decks and executive summaries to distill highly technical information into digestible insights

Company Overview:

Loris is an AI company building NLP-based conversational intelligence software for CX teams to understand their customer needs in real time.

Loris now works with fast-growing D2C and B2C brands across multiple industries including marketplace, fintech and delivery, and our novel dataset consists of millions of anonymized textual interactions between businesses and their customers.

The idea of Loris was born from Crisis Text Line, a nonprofit organization that provides free, text-based counseling. Everyone on our team believes language matters, and we are an empathy-first organization. We look forward to growing our team with like-minded, multidisciplinary individuals from diverse backgrounds. We're based in NYC and Tel Aviv and backed by top investors, including Vertex, Floodgate, and Jeff Weiner.

Loris.ai focuses on Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Natural Language Processing, and Customer Service. Their company has offices in New York City and Tel Aviv-Yafo. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees. To date, Loris.ai has raised $2M of funding; their latest round was closed on February 2018.

You can view their website at http://loris.ai or find them on Twitter and LinkedIn

jobs.description:
New York is leading the nation in the fight on global climate change and the transition to a clean energy-powered economy. The Climate Leadership and Community Protection Act (Climate Act) has created the most aggressive climate change goals in the nation and requires an ambitious agenda that blends proven catalysts with innovative approaches while operating across a broader energy arena that is... rapidly evolving. New York State Energy Research & Development Authority (NYSERDA) is a driving force in realizing this agenda. NYSERDA works with stakeholders that span residents, business owners, developers, community leaders, local government officials, universities, utilities, investors, entrepreneurs, and more, to develop, invest, and foster conditions that:
• Attract the private sector capital investment needed to expand New York’s clean energy economy.
• Overcome barriers to using clean energy at a large-scale in New York.
• Enable New York’s communities and residents to benefit equitably from energy efficiency and renewable energy.

Job Overview

NYSERDA seeks a .NET Business Analyst to join our highly agile team of professionals dedicated to delivering high quality project deliverables through thorough and thoughtful planning as well as consultation with a wide variety of users. The .Net Business Analyst is a key member of the team responsible for understanding, documenting, and mapping business processes to appropriate technology solutions based on .NET (C#) and Microsoft Azure. The .NET Business Analyst is also responsible for doing gap analysis on existing systems to determine where development is needed.

Primary Responsibilities
• Identify business needs, elicit specifications and requirements, and collaborate with customers and other IT team members to develop innovative solutions
• Prepare functional specifications, review with customer, and revise as needed, obtain sign off
• Provide analysis for projects involving systems design or redesign
• Serve as a customer liaison, represent the department as needed on project teams and working groups
• Document system processes, configurations, and changes
• Manage multiple projects and assignments concurrently; meet established deadlines
• Communicate to management and end-users in meaningful and understandable terms
• Facilitate communication and collaboration among diverse groups at all levels of the organization
• Serve as a resource for other team members
• Understand and adhere to NYSERDA’s policies and procedures.
• Perform other responsibilities as assigned

Minimum Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems or a related field, and two years experience in systems analysis work; or
• Associates degree and five years of experience in systems analysis work;
• Certificates from recognized programs that indicate mastery of tools and techniques relevant to the assignment may substitute for up to six months of experience.
• Experience translating business needs into formal requirements
• Experience creating functional and technical documentation
• Ability to communicate technically complex concepts in easy-to-understand terms
• Ability to communicate effectively and clearly with both technical and non-technical staff
• Ability to focus on details to create a reliable and accurate work product
• Experience with relational databases and complex data structures; ability to create basic SQL queries
• Knowledge of end user data manipulation tools
• Strong organizational and time management skills
• Ability to facilitate internal end-user training on new or substantially modified systems.
• Ability to facilitate User Acceptance Testing sessions
• Experience triaging bug and enhancement tickets and helping to diagnose system problems
• Knowledge of data security and encryption
• Ability to keep up with technology advancements

Preferred Qualifications
• Relevant certifications in .NET, Microsoft Azure, or other cloud computing technologies
• Experience with requirements decomposition
• Experience with requirements traceability analysis
• Experience with Agile development practices (e.g. Scrum)
• Experience with systems analysis for software systems leveraging .NET and/or Microsoft Azure
• Knowledge of report creation tools
• Experience establishing, documenting, and maintaining procedures and processes

Please submit two files, one for your cover letter and another for a resume.

NYSERDA is exclusively working with a recruitment partner who will be responsible for the initial screening of the resumes for this position.

jobs.title: Legacy Replacement Project Business Analysis Supervisor
jobs.description:
Company Description

Job Description...

PLEASE NOTE: Applicants must be serving as a permanent Computer Systems Manager, in order to apply.

NYCERS is seeking an experienced professional to serve as a Legacy Replacement Project (LRP) Business Analysis (BA)Supervisor. Under managerial direction, with wide latitude for independent judgment and initiative, the LRP BA Supervisor will be responsible for assisting in leading and managing of others within the team.

Primary Responsibilities:
-Manage team of Business Analysts working on NYCERS' Legacy Replacement Project
-Assist in the Management of the day-to-day operational aspects of team
-Act as a point of escalation for issues raised by those in the team (Troubleshoot problems identified, Initiate follow-up corrective actions)
-Handle business and project issues proactively and escalates appropriately
-Uphold team standards and operating procedures and facilitate effective team and project interaction
-Manage LRP resources in accordance with project schedule
-Lead and Facilitate User Acceptance Testing
-Act as lead liaison between Vendor, IT and business teams
-Assist in the facilitation of team and business meetings
-Design process flows, write requirements, and test systems
-Lead internal team tasks and mentor those with less experience in the team
-Rate and evaluate job performance of subordinates through observations, record keeping
-Product Quality Assurance: Ensure that all deliverables meet the organization's quality standards
-Partner with the business units to identify, develop and implement process improvement initiatives facilitated by technology capabilities or process re-engineering.
-Work with various business units to identify, propose, analyze and evaluate solutions that most effectively meet business and organizational needs and strategic/tactical goals
-Participate in the evaluations of the As-Is process and the analysis and documentation of the To-Be process improvements in support of the Business Process Reengineering efforts.
-Provide project teams with a clear understanding of business needs, requirements and specifications
-Assist project managers with scoping, estimation, reporting, scheduling, risk management, and communication as required

Qualifications

1. A master's degree in computer science from an accredited college or university and three (3) years of progressively more responsible, full-time, satisfactory experience in Information Technology (IT) including applications development, systems development, data communications and networking, database administration, data processing, or user services. At least eighteen (18) months of this experience must have been in an administrative, managerial or executive capacity in the areas of applications development, systems development, data communications and networking, database administration, data processing or in the supervision of staff performing these duties; or

2. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university and four (4) years of progressively more responsible, full-time, satisfactory experience as described in "1" above; or

3. A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent, and six (6) years of progressively more responsible, full-time, satisfactory experience as described in "1" above; or

4. A satisfactory combination of education and experience equivalent to "1", "2" or "3" above. However, all candidates must have at least a four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent and must possess at least three (3) years of experience as described in "1" above, including the eighteen (18) months of administrative, managerial, executive or supervisory experience as described in "1" above.

In the absence of a baccalaureate degree, undergraduate credits may be substituted for a maximum of two (2) years of the required experience in IT on the basis of 30 semester credits for six (6) months of the required experience. Graduate credits in computer science may be substituted for a maximum of one (1) year of the required experience in IT on the basis of 30 graduate semester credits in computer science for one (1) year of the required IT experience. However, undergraduate and/or graduate credits may not be substituted for the eighteen (18) months of experience in an administrative, managerial, executive, or supervisory capacity as described in "1" above.

Additional Information

The City of New York is an inclusive equal opportunity employer committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse workforce and providing a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment based upon any legally protected status or protected characteristic, including but not limited to an individual's sex, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity, or pregnancy

jobs.title: Product Development Business Analyst
jobs.description:
At BBH we value diverse backgrounds, so if your experience looks a little different from what we've outlined and you think you can bring value to the role, we will still welcome your application!

What You Can Expect At BBH...

If you join BBH you will find a collaborative environment that enables you to step outside your role to add value wherever you can. You will have direct access to clients, information and experts across all business areas around the world. BBH will provide you with opportunities to grow your expertise, take on new challenges, and reinvent yourself—without leaving the firm. We encourage a culture of inclusion that values each employee’s unique perspective. We provide a high-quality benefits program emphasizing good health, financial security, and peace of mind. Ultimately we want you to have rewarding work with the flexibility to enjoy personal and family experiences at every career stage. Our BBH Cares program offers volunteer opportunities to give back to your community and help transform the lives of others.

As an FX Product Development Business Analyst, you will sit directly in Markets and be responsible for supporting our strategic InfoFX and emerging markets products. This includes leading InfoFX client onboards, supporting the implementation of new technology efforts, and providing day-to-day support internally to the Foreign Exchange trading desk and externally to our clients with respect to InfoFX and our Custody FX services.

This role partners directly with our New Business Development team as a subject matter expert on InfoFX and related matters during the sale process. Once a client is committed, the FX Product Development Business Analyst will assist with the onboarding of the client onto our products. This includes integration with the client’s systems, coordinating documentation with legal, and instructing our back office to open and setup accounts. Once the client is live, this analyst will remain involved in the relationship moving forward and will liaise with our FX desk to help participate in client meetings, provide day to day support and help manage their FX program.

The FX Product Development Business Analyst will also help lead and support our emerging markets InfoFX and Custody FX business. This includes researching and responding to emerging market FX related inquiries from our global client base and internal BBH teams. As well as participate in client or sales discussions and presentations as they pertain to our emerging market suite of FX products. The individual will help to support BBH FX’s relationships with our contacts in local markets (i.e. FX counterparties, subcustodians).

Since this role will be expected to partner across many internal teams, (Relationship Management, Trading, Sales, Technology, Documentation, Investment Operations, Service Delivery and Custody), as well as supporting clients directly, we are searching for a candidate with strong communication and an interest in building relationships. The ideal candidate will also have a strong interest for Foreign Exchange and Technology.

Key Responsibilities Include

Info FX Implementation, Onboarding:
• Operate as the client’s FX subject matter expert during implementations.
• Research and analyze the impact of market changes to BBH clients.
• Assist in the identification of process improvements to lower costs and improve efficiencies.
• Leverage expertise from other BBH lines of business
• Document procedures, opportunities, best practices, project goals and workflows.

Client Service/Relationship Management
• Build and maintain relationships at all levels, both within and outside the organization
• Assess and provide solutions for clients, acting as a key point of contact for enhancement requests and escalated onboarding and production issues.
• Participate in relationship meetings to communicate InfoFX product strategy to clients.

Emerging Markets
• Research and respond to emerging market FX related inquiries from global client base and internal BBH teams.
• Participate in client sales discussions and presentations as they pertain to our emerging market suite of FX products.
• Utilize information from BBH FX relationship managers and FX clients to understand emerging market trading needs and changes in local market practices.
• Design, create, and maintain detailed FX trading guides, including client case studies that highlight innovative and thoughtful trading solutions in restricted markets
• Continually expand understanding of our industry concepts and market practices through responses to client queries, participation in departmental projects, and regular interaction with Operations, Treasury, Network and Trading functions.
• Work with local market providers to support BBH FX’s operations in local markets.

Desired Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience required
• 5+ years of relevant work experience
• Experience working in the financial services industry
• Knowledge of BBH products, services and practices is a plus
• General knowledge of the SWIFT platform and messaging is a plus
• Strong business analysis skills, including business requirements, product proposals and business and technical workflows
• Strong interpersonal and collaboration skills
• Knowledge of international currency markets, including the impact of economic and political factors, a plus
• Knowledge of foreign exchange trading instruments, a plus
• Strong project management, problem solving and analytical skills
• Strong organizational, consultative, and advisory skills
• Knowledge of emerging trends in the industry
• Ability to analyze and summarize complex business issues
• Ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously, while meeting deadlines
• Strong written and verbal communication skills, including presentations.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, genetic information, creed, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other protected status under federal, state or local law.

Salary Range

$110K - $125K

BBH’s compensation program includes base salary, discretionary bonuses, and profit-sharing. The anticipated base salary range(s) shown above are only for the indicated location(s) and may differ in other locations due to cost of living and labor considerations. Base salaries may vary based on factors such as skill, experience and qualification for the role. BBH's total rewards package recognizes your contributions with more than just a paycheck—providing you with benefits that enhance your experience at BBH from long-term savings, healthcare, and income protection to professional development opportunities and time off, our programs support your overall well-being

jobs.title: Senior Business Analyst -- IT
jobs.description:
Job Description: Senior Business Analyst -- IT Request
Job Location: Queens, NY
Job Duration: 6 Months...

Position Summary
This role will work directly with the Executive Director Finance, providing financial models and business analysis to support the Vice President, Global IT Partner Strategy's assessment of global sourcing opportunities for the Information Technology department.

This role sits under the Vice President, Global IT Partner Strategy team.

Roles & Responsibilities

§ Financial Responsibility matrix

§ Rate Cards
§ Termination for Convenience Fees

- Analyses of the Cost Term Sheet for the Finalist
- Analyses of bidders' Final Rates and Price for Services
• Support the development and assessment of the Pricing/ Financial ITO SOW Support Model
• Support all other financial analyses as required by the ITO Cost program

Qualifications
Skills & Requirements
Experience Preferred:
- 3-5 years' experience in business analysis (no CPAs!)
- Microsoft Office Proficiency: expert in Excel (vlookups, pivot tables, data manipulation; proficient in PowerPoint; skilled in Access)
- Excellent written and oral communication and presentation skills in American English
- Experience working in a global environment
- Ability to make decisions and find innovative solutions to complex problems with minimal supervision
- Effective time management, prioritization, negotiating and organizational skills
- Customer focused attitude
- Vendor Management Skills
- Prior IT Asset Management, Sourcing, or Leasing experience
- Teamwork and Cooperation
- Positively react to shifting priorities
- Ability to communicate at various degrees of detail (peers, finance, management)
- Analytical & good attention to detail
- Experience/proficiency in ERM systems and software, such as SAP and Hyperion

Core Competencies:
1. Thinks Strategically: Takes a broad view of the business, industry, and consumer environment to anticipate and plan for the future. Identifies the focus and defines where to play, how to achieve, and how to negotiate successful agreements.
2. Builds Collaborative Relationships: Builds relationships based on trust and respect within the organization and its supplier network. Promotes the inclusion of diverse knowledge, skills, and experiences to achieve results.
3. Demonstrates Learning Agility: Ability to anticipate change, adapt to new priorities, face reality, draw conclusions, and swiftly mobilize to adapt to changing needs and demands

jobs.title: Business Technical Analyst
jobs.description:
Altice USA is a cutting-edge communications, media, and tech company. We connect people to what matters most to them; texting with friends, advertising that resonates, or binge watching their favorite show. Our differentiated approach centers around technologies that push the envelope and deliver the ultimate customer experience. We’re building a workforce that attracts and retains the best... talent, not only to meet the needs of our customers, but that also reflects the diverse communities we serve.

Job Summary

The Business Technical Analyst is the go-to resource for providing multi-level support for the Contact Centers, addressing concerns raised via chats, emails, and phone that may have impact to the business operations. Their primary focus will be to ensure the highest level of IT stability for Contact Center functionality by analyzing data, identifying trends, and performing root cause analysis. They will collaborate with various business groups, manage outages and tickets, and serves as the key technical liaison with our business partners to deliver IT requirements that align with our business' needs. The Analyst will also conduct knowledge transfer sessions to other teams, keeping them updated on process enhancements and troubleshooting techniques.

Responsibilities
• Triage concerns brought about by the business and determine if concern is a technical issue or related to customer education.
• Handle system-wide application issues and vendor outages by managing communications between IT, Contact Center management, and vendors.
• Utilize ServiceNow ticketing system to manage incidents and requests in order of severity.
• Monitor and ensure performance of IVR and Chat applications, Contact Center tools, and other Contact Center functionalities.
• Manage Virtual Call Center opening and closing process based on business operation hours.
• Develop reports and analyze the data to identify trends in the Contact Centers.
• Ensures that system implementations conform to established company standards and/or industry best practices.
• Develops documentation including operational manuals, run books, procedures, and problem resolutions.
• Understand and can convey IVR and Chat flows to business and IT teams in a manner that is easily understood.
• Analyze chat bot interactions, intents, and the associated customer journeys to identify, augment and implement appropriate solution(s).
• Participates in an on-call rotation to support the business needs.
• Optimize Chat flows to provide a seamless customer experience through the customer interactions.
• Conducts meetings with various groups to drive to root cause and resolve outstanding issues.
• Maintains and creates documentation around vendor contacts, design, and processes.
• Aides and participates in the onboarding of new business partners.
• Assists in decommissioning of vendors, processes, tools, and reclaiming of licenses.
• Also performs other tasks as assigned.

#LI-LP1

Qualifications
• A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or equivalent work experience is required
• Knowledge of principles, theories, methods, materials, and equipment used in the design, installation, operation, and maintenance of telecommunications, LAN, and WAN technologies
• Knowledge of databases and the ability to conduct basic data gathering queries
• Ability to manage large quantities of data to produce usable business insight and to perform root cause analysis
• Able to troubleshoot technical problems and critically think through issues with minimal supervision
• Ability to organize, plan, and resolve incidents with minimal supervision
• Ability to communicate clearly, concisely, and professionally in verbal and written responses
• Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills
• Ability to perform multiple tasks, and adjust priorities based on workload and direction from management

jobs.title: Business Analyst
jobs.description:
Business Analyst

Apply now Job no: 511017...
Position type: Staff
Location: New York
Categories: Information Systems/Technology

Posting Summary:

Teachers College IT seeks an enthusiastic, analytical thinker to support administrative and academic teams at the College as they explore and implement new technology.

Job Summary/Basic Function:

About TCIT
Teachers College Information Technology (TCIT) provides technology infrastructure and services that advance teaching and learning, enable research, enrich the student experience, and effectively manage institutional information, in support of Teachers College as the premier graduate institution of education.

TCIT's core values - respect, teamwork, transparency, reliability, and innovation - bind us as a team that is committed to excellence in service and project delivery while keeping Teachers College an exciting place to work, advance one's career, and maintain a healthy balance between work and home.

As a member of the TCIT, you will be empowered with trust, ownership, training, and support from your colleagues, who are here to help you succeed and grow. You will work on diverse projects with exposure to a wide array of technological building blocks, often partnering with stakeholders from across the College. If you are kind, creative, and professional, we'd love to hear from you.

About this Position
The Business Analyst is a member of the TCIT Project Management Office (PMO). This individual is responsible for partnering with stakeholders in administrative and academic roles at the College to design solutions and initiatives that enhance the quality of IT products and services. The position reports to the Director of the Project Management Office.

This position manages the intake of project requests (demands) and connects with stakeholders to understand their needs and scope the project to align with the College's and Department's strategic objectives. This process can often require research of industry application offerings to support fit-gap analyses. They facilitate the demand review and application assessment processes required before a project can be approved and added to the roadmap. They liaise between business users and IT stakeholders to properly document requirements and specifications.

Business Analysts also participate in the execution of projects - sometimes leading the effort, and sometimes supporting business or technical users in requirements definition, solution design, testing, training, and communications/rollout.

CHARACTERISTIC DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Facilitate demand intake/review and application assessment processes.
• Liaise between business and academic stakeholders and TCIT; facilitate cross-functional design and requirements processes.
• Understand peer departments' business needs and strategic plans for growth.
• Analyze technical systems, interfaces, and processes to optimize solution design.
• Perform research using available data and industry information to support decision making and identify technological solutions for business needs.
• Document requirements and functional specifications.
• Structure application and interface testing efforts.
• Prepare training materials and communications to support initiative rollout and strategic alignment.

Minimum Qualifications:
• 2-5 years experience in business analysis or product/application management.
• Excellent problem-solving skills.
• Analytical mindset.
• Exceptional interpersonal skills and ability to present information to different audiences.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• Attention to detail.
• Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.
• Experience with requirements documentation, building detailed reports, and presentation design.
• Interest in IT applications and solutions research.

Salary Range:

$72,000 - $90,000

Competitive Compensation and Benefits

The salary range reflects the College's good faith and reasonable estimate of the compensation for the position at the time of the job posting. Salary decisions are dependent on several factors including but not limited to market and organizational considerations, experience, and qualifications of a selected candidate as well as internal and external equity.

Our benefits contribute significantly to the total compensation package that includes medical, dental, vision, and supplemental insurance plans; flexible and hybrid work schedules; tuition remission; life insurance; short and long-term disability insurance; an exceptional employer retirement matching program; health savings accounts (HSA), flexible spending accounts (FSA), Public Service Loan Forgiveness eligibility, and a robust Employee Assistance Program (EAP).

If you would like to request any disability related accommodations to complete the job application or to participate in the interview process, please email:oasid@tc.columbia.edu.

Hybrid/Remote

Teachers College maintains a hybrid work environment, which provides employees with flexible work arrangements, while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person college-campus culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite or in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days). Employees are expected to live within a 150-mile radius of the College.

We will consider qualified candidates that reside beyond this radius based on the responsibilities and duties expected of the position. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Teachers College is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive academic community and to providing equal opportunity in employment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration regardless of race, color, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity or gender expression), religion, creed, national origin, age, citizenship, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

jobs.title: Business Analyst
jobs.description:
Garnet River® is a full-service information technology company that customizes solutions for its clients. We solve challenges through staff augmentation, project-based teams and technical solutions. Our staffing division works as a recruiting arm for companies in the region and across the country. Clients turn to us to help them find professional talent.

We are currently seeking a Business... Analyst who will help client stakeholders identify a grants and scholarship management solution that will maximize the value delivered by the application development team. The business analyst will investigate business systems, elements of the organization structure, and document requirements using industry standard techniques. This position requires an onsite presence in Albany, New York. The office currently supports a hybrid work model but full-time onsite may be required later.

Annual salary range for this position is $85,000 - $130,000.

Job Duties
• Analyze existing system documentation and related artifacts to elicit detailed requirements.
• Analyze and understand as-is business processes and systems sufficiently to establish to-be workflows and designs.
• Liaise with relevant stakeholders, including subject matter experts (SMEs), executive teams, managers, program directors, and end users to meet the business needs of the project.
• Conduct requirements gathering, validation, and rationalization processes.
• Collaborate with the team on requirements definition to confirm that system requirements align with state and federal standards and strategy.
• Evaluate project timelines and priorities.
• Adhere to internal controls, guidelines, and procedures pertaining to the systems development life cycle.
• Provide guidance to application development resource(s), through product backlogs, user stories, roadmaps, sprint plans, and related artifacts.
• Ensure application development resource(s) understand the features and enhancements that need to be developed and deployed to meet the business needs of the project.
• Support software validation through user acceptance and similar test strategies.
• Develop test scenarios and test cases for system, integration and UAT using requirements, process flows and use cases/user stories. Test system functionality and document test result
• Assist with change control and release planning for system bug fixes, enhancements and upgrades
• Participate in data migration planning, analysis, and cleansing, working closely with DBA’s, vendor and Business owners.
• Provide project management support as needed.

Required Qualifications
• Bachelor’s Degree in Math, Sciences, Engineering, or Computer Science preferred.
• 5 years of relevant experience
• 60 months+ experience in performing requirements gathering and business analysis, producing written documentation of requirements; system design and implementation.
• 60 months+ of requirements elicitation and documentation with participants.
• 36 months+ working experience performing application testing, developing and executing written test scripts, documenting, tracking, communicating, and reporting defects utilizing testing tools such as Jira, quality center, or rationale.
• 60 months+ of experience in developing business requirements by translating the needs, expectations, constraints and interfaces into a format understandable to both clients and technologists, using various methods (e.g., brainstorming, document analysis, facilitated meetings, focus groups, interface analysis, interviews, observation, prototyping, requirements workshops, reverse engineering, survey questionnaire by asking the right questions to surface essential requirements information).
• 60 months+ experience working to establish criteria for evaluation and acceptance of requirements, manage requirements scope, obtains commitment to the requirements from the project participants. Identifies project work and requirements inconsistencies during defect / requirements management and communication.
• 60 months+ of experience in requirement analysis and validation, analyzes requirements to ensure that they are complete, feasible, realizable and verifiable. Provide the capability to identify key requirements that have a strong influence on cost, schedule, functionality, risk or performance.
• 60 months+ of experience to analyzes requirements and represent the requirements textually as well as via visual models or graphical form, in order to communicate the requirements effectively to the required audience.

At Garnet River, we care about our employees. We strongly believe in work/family balance. Our robust employee benefits package includes a competitive salary, PTO and health insurance (including dental and vision.

jobs.title: Operations and Analytics Associate
jobs.description:
Are you a driven and dynamic individual seeking an exciting opportunity to contribute to a thriving nationwide mobility marketplace? As an Operations & Analytics Associate, you will play a pivotal role in enhancing the growth and success of our platform. Your primary responsibility will be to strategize and execute initiatives aimed at enhancing engagement and user satisfaction.

Key... Responsibilities:

Marketplace Analysis: Conduct in-depth analysis of user behavior, preferences, and market trends to identify opportunities and issues.

Campaign Planning and Execution: Develop and execute marketing campaigns and promotional activities to attract and engage users, collaborating closely with the marketing and creative teams.

Pricing Strategies: Analyze pricing structures and recommend adjustments based on demand patterns and market dynamics.

Data-Driven Decision Making: Utilize data analytics to make informed decisions, track performance, and optimize strategies accordingly.

Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with various teams, including product, engineering, marketing, and customer support, to align initiatives with broader company goals. Monitor and Report: Track key performance indicators (KPIs) and prepare regular reports for management to measure the success and impact of initiatives. Stay Updated: Keep abreast of industry trends, competitor activities, and regulatory changes that may affect market dynamics.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree Proven experience in operations or business analysis roles Strong analytical skills and proficiency in data analysis tools and Excel. Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively across teams. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to changing priorities. Passion for the mobility industry and a genuine interest in understanding user behaviors.

As part of our Operations & Analytics team, you will play a crucial role at the intersection of technology and user experience. jobs.title: Data Analyst
jobs.description:
About the Position

William W. Pro Staff is looking for a Business Analyst to join our client's team in New York, NY. The Business Analyst will be responsible for providing support to our clients and partners by analyzing business trends, identifying opportunities for improvement, and recommending solutions...

Job Description

The Business Analyst will play a key role in the successful implementation of the company project by contributing significantly to information gathered regarding existing business processes across legacy systems and analyzing how the existing functionality should be configured in the new system while ensuring no adverse impact to business operations. This analyst will also be responsible for coordinating with key stakeholder groups, gathering information and requirements from these groups, and being an advocate for this new platform.

Tasks:
• Lead company effort to gather documentation and detailed requirements related existing business processes across legacy solutions
• Translate problem statements and solution hypotheses into requirements, user stories, and customer journeys
• Evaluate business processes to uncover areas for improvement and work with SI to optimally implement processes in the new solution
• Articulate company needs in discovery sessions with the SI and support mapping out overall processes
• Review and validate SI developed requirements for the system with company stakeholders and work with the SI to define how these requirements will be implemented in the new solution –coordinating with company business and technical SMEs as needed
• Provide guidance on the prioritization of company requirements
• During build phases – ensure the developed solution meets business needs and requirements by participating in quality assurance activities and facilitating co decision-making within regarding requirements configuration in the new platform through analyses and recommendations
• Facilitate and perform User Acceptance Testing. Support analysis of testing results and prioritization of corrections
• Consistently review and evaluate requests from stakeholders, performs research and analysis to understand the request and potential implementation impacts, and prioritizes based on urgency.
• Prepare meetings with stakeholders with relevant agenda items and questions regarding requirements.
• Analyze existing requirements and identifies any missing or weak requirements that need additional follow-up and analysis with IT teams and stakeholders.
• Prepare demonstrations as needed to explain various configuration options to stakeholders

Associated deliverables:
• Business requirements, user stories, and customer journey maps
• As-is and To-be Process maps
• Product backlog refinement and prioritization
• Options Analyses and Recommendations
• Stakeholder feedback
• Presentations

Required Skills for Business Analyst
• 6+ years of business analysis, data analysis, and/or project management experience on information technology projects, including but not limited to software development, network, security, and/or information systems projects.
• Experience documenting business requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria
• Excellent interpersonal skills including, collaborating, team building, facilitation skills, negotiation skills, and conflict resolution skills
• Exceptionally detail-oriented; able to analyze requirements and think outside the box to develop innovative solutions to meet business needs
• Strong analytical, planning, and organizational skills
• Excellent oral and written communication skills when interacting with both business and IT individuals at all levels
• Knowledge of Agile principles and values and experience participating in or leading agile/scrum projects
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Project, Excel, PowerPoint, and Word), SharePoint

Preferred Skills

Professional/Certified Scrum Master or Certified Scrum Product Owner certification

jobs.title: Business Analysis Manager - Full-time / Part-time
jobs.description:
How many people can answer the question, "What do you do for a living?" with the answer, "I help find cures for cancer." At LLS, employees take our mission seriously. Whether you work in one of our chapters, are an accountant at the national office or a specialist in our Information Resource Center, you work each day on making our mission a reality: Cure leukemia, lymphoma, Hodgkin's disease and... myeloma, and improve the quality of life of patients and their families. Join us and give new meaning to the word, "job."

As the Business Analysis Manager at LLS, you will play a key leadership role responsible for overseeing a team of business analysts within the organization. This role plays a crucial part in facilitating the alignment of business processes, requirements, and strategies. The manager is tasked with guiding and supporting the business analyst team to drive business improvement and innovation. The Business Analysis Manager plays a pivotal role in driving the success of an organization by ensuring that business processes and strategies are effectively aligned with the goals and objectives of the company. This position requires a combination of technical expertise, leadership skills, and a deep understanding of business operations.

As a valued member of LLS, you are eligible for a comprehensive benefits package. Our offerings include medical, dental, and vision insurance; life insurance; flexible spending accounts; a 403b retirement plan along with generous paid time off. In addition, we observe federal paid holidays throughout the year, and offer a wellness program and an employee assistance pro

While employees may be permitted to work remotely, travel to the assigned office, HUB or Satellite Offices may be required as determined by the employee's manager and the employee's Strategic Talent Partner.

Key Responsibilities:
• Team Leadership: Foster a collaborative and motivated work environment in addition to providing guidance and support to a team of business analysts.
• Requirements Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and document detailed business requirements for various projects and initiatives.
• Data Analysis: Analyze data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can inform business decisions and drive process improvements.
• Process Mapping: Create process maps and workflows to visualize current and future business processes, highlighting areas for optimization.
• Documentation: Prepare clear and concise business requirement documents, use cases, and user stories to guide development teams.
• Stakeholder Communication: Facilitate effective communication between business and technical teams, ensuring alignment throughout project lifecycles.
• Testing and Validation: Develop test plans, test cases, and participate in user acceptance testing to ensure solutions meet business requirements.
• Risk Assessment: Identify and assess potential risks and issues related to projects and propose mitigation strategies.
• Reporting and Metrics: Develop and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) and dashboards to track project progress and business performance.
• Continuous Improvement: Collaborate with teams to identify opportunities for process improvement and automation, making data-driven recommendations.
• Process Development: Leverage experience to co-create foundational processes needed for Enterprise Business Architecture teams to scale and grow.
• Perform other related duties as assigned.

Basic Qualifications:
• Minimum 10 years Business Analyst experience within the nonprofit industry and/or consulting space.
• Strong leadership and project management skills.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to gather and interpret data, identify trends, and make informed recommendations.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively convey complex information to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
• Solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development and workflow processing including Agile and Waterfall Project Management methodologies.
• Strong interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and build relationships with stakeholders.
• The ability to adapt to changing priorities, technologies, and business processes.

• Work environment is representative and typical of similar jobs in comparable organizations.

jobs.description:
Role Context

We are looking for an Associate Director, Business Analytics and Measurement who will deliver campaign analysis to understand the efficiency and effectiveness of audience-driven strategies as well as monitor, suggest optimizations and capture learnings to refine audience-driven strategies and deliver support business outcomes. You will also identify a measurement framework to... implement as well as solutions and measurement partners leading to measuring the impact of media investments.

Core Responsibilities
• Extract and organize data from a multitude of sources to feed business-improving insights (campaign performance, social listening, competitive analysis …) and optimize business outcomes
• Build thoughtful presentations/reports to deliver the right performance narrative to clients
• Partner with internal teams across all functions to learn the most efficient and effective way to extract value from data and develop a story telling approach grounded in client business reality and brand objectives
• Provide optimization recommendation to clients to support the most efficient and effective channels, partners, and tactics
• Identify gaps/requirements from a measurement standpoint

Required Skills / Experience
• Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Advertising, Economics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Analytics, or related field with 3 years of work experience in measurement and analytics strategy applicable to marketing and/or media,
• Comprehensive understanding of media metrics (e.g., impression, CTR, CPM GRP, CPV etc.), Measurement analytics, Quantitative business measures (LTV, ROI, Effectiveness, etc.), Statistics (Correlations, sample sizing, t-value VIF etc.),
• Strong familiarity with statistical/data mining concepts and methods (e.g., OLS, Logit, time Series, etc.); ability to program in SQL,
• Experience working with measurement partners for brand lift, conversion lift, MMM and MTA (e.g., Millward Brown, Nielsen, Lucid, Dynata, Neustar … and others),
• Experience with Google Campaign Manager, Double Verify, DMPs, DSPs, Google Analytics required,

• Ability and comfort with presenting work by phone or within small groups
• Strong speaking and written professional communication skills,
• Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills,
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office software such as Word, PowerPoint, and Excel (ability to work with macros, advanced formulas, pivot tables),
• The ability to thrive in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment,
• Strategic Thinker & Doer,
• Curious and excited to learn,

We believe there always is a better way to grow. We positively provoke growth for our clients by reshaping consumer decision-making and experiences through media, content and technology.
